org.youscope.plugin.continousimaging

Interface ShortContinuousImagingJob

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component, ImageProducer, Job, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface ShortContinuousImagingJob
extends Job, ImageProducer
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

      • setExposure

        void setExposure(double exposure)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, it sets the exposure of all cameras. Set to -1 if exposure should not be set.
        Parameters:
        exposure - The exposure.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getExposure

        double getExposure()
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the exposure. If more than one camera is initialized, returns the exposure of the first camera.
        Returns:
        The exposure.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setExposures

        void setExposures(double[] exposures)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  MeasurementRunningException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the exposures of the cameras. Should have the same size as cameras, otherwise an exception is thrown. Each element can be set to -1 to not set the exposure for the given camera.
        Parameters:
        exposures - The exposures.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if number of elements in exposure array is unequal to the number of cameras.

      • getExposures

        double[] getExposures()
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the exposures of the initialized cameras.
        Returns:
        The exposures.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setCameras

        void setCameras(java.lang.String[] cameras)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the cameras with which it should be imaged. If set to null, the default (currently initialized) camera is used. Each camera should only appear ones in the array. One element of the array can be NULL, such that the default camera is used.
        Parameters:
        cameras - Device names of the cameras
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(java.lang.String camera)
        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
               MeasurementRunningException
        Sets the camera with which it should be imaged. If set to null, the default (currently initialized) camera is used.
        Parameters:
        camera - Device name of the camera, or null to use default camera.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getCameras

        java.lang.String[] getCameras()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the cameras.
        Returns:
        The cameras.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getCamera

        java.lang.String getCamera()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the name of the camera with which it is imaged. Might return null if the default camera is used. If more than one camera is used, returns the first camera.
        Returns:
        The cameras.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • isBurstImaging

        boolean isBurstImaging()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns if the imaging is done in burst mode. This corresponds to that the job queries for all images in the image buffer, not only for the newest one, every time it is executed.
        Returns:
        True if in burst mode, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • setBurstImaging

        void setBurstImaging(boolean burst)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                     MeasurementRunningException
        Sets if the images are produced in burst mode. This corresponds to that the job queries for all images in the image buffer, not only for the newest one, every time it is executed. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        burst - True if burst imaging should be activated, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setImageDescription

        void setImageDescription(java.lang.String description)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         MeasurementRunningException
        Sets a short string describing the images which are made by this job.
        Parameters:
        description - The description which should be returned for the images produced by this job, or null, to switch to the default description.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • setImagingPeriod

        void setImagingPeriod(int imagingPeriod)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      MeasurementRunningException
        Parameters:
        imagingPeriod - The time between two successive images.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MeasurementRunningException

      • getImagingPeriod

        int getImagingPeriod()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns:
        The time between two successive images.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
